intro: Oxycoccus oxycoccos, commonly known as the cranberry bush, is a species of dwarf shrub native to northern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, dark red berries that are edible. The plant typically grows in acidic, nutrient-poor soils and thrives in wet, boggy environments. Its leaves are evergreen, and it produces white or pinkish flowers in the spring. The berries are rich in antioxidants and have been used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
